3.9.0.0.message: Fix a bug where the return values from `get_redis_connection()` are mistaken.
Fixed an issue that caused an HTTP 500 error when `hide_client_headers` is set to `true` and the request exceeds the rate limit.

3.8.1.0.message: Fixed an issue that caused an HTTP 500 error when `hide_client_headers` is set to `true` and the request exceeds the rate limit.

3.8.0.0.message: Fixed an issue of DP reporting that deprecated config fields are used when configuration from CP is pushed

3.6.0.0.message: fix to provide better accuracy in counters when sync_rate is used with the redis policy.
fix an issuer where all counters are synced to the same DB at the same rate.
Standardize redis configuration across plugins. The redis configuration right now follows common schema that is shared across other plugins.
add support for consumer group scoping
support to ratelimit by consumer group

3.5.0.2.message: fix an issuer where all counters are synced to the same DB at the same rate.

3.4.3.1.message: fix an issuer where all counters are synced to the same DB at the same rate.

3.2.2.4.message: The redis rate limiting strategy now returns an error when Redis Cluster is down.

3.1.0.0.message: The HTTP status code and response body for rate-limited requests can now be customized. Thanks, [@utix](https://github.com/utix)! [#8930](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8930)

3.0.0.0.message: Updated the priority for some plugins.: `rate-limiting` changed from `901` to `910`
The default policy is now local for all deployment modes.[#9344](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/9344)
Fixed a PostgreSQL deadlock issue that occurred when the `cluster` policy was used with two or more metrics (for example, `second` and `day`.)[#8968](https://github.com/Kong/kong/pull/8968)

2.8.1.2.message: Fixed a PostgreSQL deadlock issue that occurred when the `cluster` policy was used with two or more metrics (for example, `second` and `day`.)

2.8.0.0.message: Fixed a 500 error associated with performing arithmetic functions on a nil value by adding a nil value check after performing `ngx.shared.dict` operations.
